intro: Cynoglossum andicola, commonly known as the Andean ironweed, is a herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open grasslands or among shrubs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
